citations.narrative:
The licensee currently does not have a method of identification for 3 litters of unweaned puppies (six puppies in total). The
litters were born 25 September 2024, 21 October 2024, and 4 November 2024, respectively. Proper identification of
puppies is important for disease traceback and in cases of theft or loss. Correct by ensuring live puppies less than 16
weeks of age have proper identification, such as an official tag, tattoo or microchip, APHIS 7005 form, or a cage card.
Correct by 25 November 2024

Two primary enclosures housing a total of 2 puppies and 2 adult female dogs have excessively worn and frayed carpet
squares. These carpet squares are used to provide solid resting surfaces in whelping enclosures. However, the carpet
fibers have become excessively frayed resulting in long strands of fibers at the edges of the squares. This could serve as
a source of potential injury to a dog if these carpet fibers become ingested or wrap around their digits. Correct by ensuring
materials used within a primary enclosure are repaired or replaced when worn or damaged.
Correct by 25 November 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(2) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
The licensee currently does not have a method of identification for 3 litters of unweaned puppies (six puppies in total). The 
litters were born 25 September 2024, 21 October 2024, and 4 November 2024, respectively. Proper identification of 
puppies is important for disease traceback and in cases of theft or loss. Correct by ensuring live puppies less than 16 
weeks of age have proper identification, such as an official tag, tattoo or microchip, APHIS 7005 form, or a cage card.  
 
Correct by 25 November 2024 
3.6(a)(2)(ix) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Two primary enclosures housing a total of 2 puppies and 2 adult female dogs have excessively worn and frayed carpet 
squares. These carpet squares are used to provide solid resting surfaces in whelping enclosures. However, the carpet 
fibers have become excessively frayed resulting in long strands of fibers at the edges of the squares. This could serve as 
a source of potential injury to a dog if these carpet fibers become ingested or wrap around their digits. Correct by ensuring 
materials used within a primary enclosure are repaired or replaced when worn or damaged.  
 
Correct by 25 November 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
 n
